intro: Kalimeris integrifolia, commonly known as the Japanese aster or Chinese aster, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped, serrated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers range in color from white to pink and yellow, and it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens. Kalimeris integrifolia is also valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
